page.title: 13EMPLOYMENT IN NORTHWOLD
page.content: A large proportion of the population of Northwold are self-employed within the village and its local area.These jobs include shop-keepers,newsagent, coppersmith,artist, builders, chartered quantity surveyor and farmers.Although much of the land around the village is farming land, farming is not responsible for the employment of a large number of people because farms tend to be highly mechanised. Employment outside the village tends to be divided equally between professional and manual jobs. Although some families have all adult members employed outside the home,the majority tend to have a working husband with the wife staying at home to bring up the children. Northwold has a small proportion of its population unemployed.
